title: CenterForMedicalGeneticsGhent/nf-cmgg-germline pipeline parameters
description: A nextflow pipeline for calling and annotating variants

input_output_options.title: Input/output options
input_output_options.description: Define where the pipeline should find input data and save output data.

input.description: Path to comma-separated file containing information about the samples in the experiment.
input.help_text: You will need to create a design file with information about the samples in your experiment before running the pipeline. Use this parameter to specify its location. It has to be a comma-separated file with samples, and a header row. See [usage docs](./usage.md).

outdir.description: The output directory where the results will be saved. You have to use absolute paths to storage on Cloud infrastructure.

email.help_text: Set this parameter to your e-mail address to get a summary e-mail with details of the run sent to you when the workflow exits. If set in your user config file (`~/.nextflow/config`) then you don't need to specify this on the command line for every run.

reference_genome_options.title: Reference genome options
reference_genome_options.description: Reference genome related files and options required for the workflow.

genome.help_text: Requires a Genome Reference Consortium reference ID (e.g. GRCh38)

fasta.help_text: This parameter is *mandatory* if `--genome` is not specified. The path to the reference genome fasta.

fai.description: Path to FASTA genome index file.

dict.description: Path to the sequence dictionary generated from the FASTA reference

strtablefile.description: Path to the STR table file generated from the FASTA reference

sdf.description: Path to the SDF folder generated from the reference FASTA file

genomes_base.description: Directory base for CMGG reference store (used when --genomes_ignore false is specified)

cmgg_config_base.description: The base directory for the local config files

genomes_ignore.description: Do not load the local references from the path specified with --genomes_base

igenomes_base.description: Directory / URL base for iGenomes references.

igenomes_ignore.description: Do not load the iGenomes reference config.
igenomes_ignore.help_text: Do not load `igenomes.config` when running the pipeline. You may choose this option if you observe clashes between custom parameters and those supplied in `igenomes.config`.

pipeline_specific_parameters.title: Pipeline specific parameters
pipeline_specific_parameters.description: Parameters that define how the pipeline works

scatter_count.description: The amount of scattering that should happen per sample.
scatter_count.help_text:
Increase this number to increase the pipeline run speed, but at the tradeoff of using more IO and disk space. This can differ from the actual scatter count in some cases (especially with smaller files).
This has an effect on HaplotypeCaller, GenomicsDBImport and GenotypeGVCFs.

merge_distance.description: The merge distance for genotype BED files
merge_distance.help_text: Increase this parameter if GenomicsDBImport is running slow. This defines the maximum distance between intervals that should be merged. The less intervals GenomicsDBImport actually gets, the faster it will run.

dragstr.description: Create DragSTR models to be used with HaplotypeCaller
dragstr.help_text: This currently is only able to run single-core per sample. Due to this, the process is very slow with only very small improvements to the analysis.

validate.help_text: This only validates individual sample GVCFs that have truth VCF supplied to them via the samplesheet (in row `truth_vcf`, with an optional index in the `truth_tbi` row)

add_ped.description: Add PED INFO header lines to the final VCFs

gemini.description: Create a Gemini databases from the final VCFs

mosdepth_slow.help_text: This is advised if you need exact coverage BED files as output

project.help_text: This will be used to specify the final output files folder in the output directory.

roi.description: Path to the default ROI (regions of interest) BED file to be used for WES analysis
roi.help_text: This will be used for all samples that do not have a specific ROI file supplied to them through the samplesheet. Don't supply an ROI file to run the analysis as WGS.

dbsnp.description: Path to the dbSNP VCF file

dbsnp_tbi.description: Path to the index of the dbSNP VCF file

somalier_sites.description: Path to the VCF file with sites for Somalier to use

only_call.description: Only call the variants without doing any post-processing

only_merge.description: Only run the pipeline until the creation of the genomicsdbs and output them

callers.description: A comma delimited string of the available callers. Current options are: 'haplotypecaller' and 'vardict'

vardict_min_af.description: The minimum allele frequency for VarDict

institutional_config_options.title: Institutional config options
institutional_config_options.description: Parameters used to describe centralised config profiles. These should not be edited.
institutional_config_options.help_text: The centralised nf-core configuration profiles use a handful of pipeline parameters to describe themselves. This information is then printed to the Nextflow log when you run a pipeline. You should not need to change these values when you run a pipeline.

custom_config_version.description: Git commit id for Institutional configs.

custom_config_base.help_text: If you're running offline, Nextflow will not be able to fetch the institutional config files from the internet. If you don't need them, then this is not a problem. If you do need them, you should download the files from the repo and tell Nextflow where to find them with this parameter.

max_job_request_options.title: Max job request options
max_job_request_options.description: Set the top limit for requested resources for any single job.
max_job_request_options.help_text:
If you are running on a smaller system, a pipeline step requesting more resources than are available may cause the Nextflow to stop the run with an error. These options allow you to cap the maximum resources requested by any single job so that the pipeline will run on your system.

Note that you can not _increase_ the resources requested by any job using these options. For that you will need your own configuration file. See [the nf-core website](https://nf-co.re/usage/configuration) for details.

max_cpus.description: Maximum number of CPUs that can be requested for any single job.
max_cpus.help_text: Use to set an upper-limit for the CPU requirement for each process. Should be an integer e.g. `--max_cpus 1`

max_memory.description: Maximum amount of memory that can be requested for any single job.
max_memory.help_text: Use to set an upper-limit for the memory requirement for each process. Should be a string in the format integer-unit e.g. `--max_memory '8.GB'`

max_time.description: Maximum amount of time that can be requested for any single job.
max_time.help_text: Use to set an upper-limit for the time requirement for each process. Should be a string in the format integer-unit e.g. `--max_time '2.h'`

generic_options.title: Generic options
generic_options.description: Less common options for the pipeline, typically set in a config file.
generic_options.help_text:
These options are common to all nf-core pipelines and allow you to customise some of the core preferences for how the pipeline runs.

Typically these options would be set in a Nextflow config file loaded for all pipeline runs, such as `~/.nextflow/config`.

publish_dir_mode.description: Method used to save pipeline results to output directory.
publish_dir_mode.help_text: The Nextflow `publishDir` option specifies which intermediate files should be saved to the output directory. This option tells the pipeline what method should be used to move these files. See [Nextflow docs](https://www.nextflow.io/docs/latest/process.html#publishdir) for details.

email_on_fail.description: Email address for completion summary, only when pipeline fails.
email_on_fail.help_text: An email address to send a summary email to when the pipeline is completed - ONLY sent if the pipeline does not exit successfully.

plaintext_email.description: Send plain-text email instead of HTML.

max_multiqc_email_size.description: File size limit when attaching MultiQC reports to summary emails.

monochrome_logs.description: Do not use coloured log outputs.

hook_url.description: Incoming hook URL for messaging service
hook_url.help_text: Incoming hook URL for messaging service. Currently, MS Teams and Slack are supported.

multiqc_title.description: MultiQC report title. Printed as page header, used for filename if not otherwise specified.

multiqc_config.description: Custom config file to supply to MultiQC.

multiqc_logo.description: Custom logo file to supply to MultiQC. File name must also be set in the MultiQC config file

multiqc_methods_description.description: Custom MultiQC yaml file containing HTML including a methods description.

validate_params.description: Boolean whether to validate parameters against the schema at runtime

validationShowHiddenParams.help_text: By default, parameters set as _hidden_ in the schema are not shown on the command line when a user runs with `--help`. Specifying this option will tell the pipeline to show all parameters.

validationSchemaIgnoreParams.description: Comma-separated list of parameters to ignore when validating against the schema

annotation_parameters.title: Annotation parameters
annotation_parameters.description: Parameters to configure Ensembl VEP and VCFanno

vep_chunk_size.description: The amount of sites per split VCF as input to VEP

species.help_text: Must be lower case and have underscores as spaces

vep_merged.description: Specify if the VEP cache is a merged cache

vep_cache.description: The path to the VEP cache

vep_dbnsfp.description: Use the dbNSFP plugin with Ensembl VEP
vep_dbnsfp.help_text: The '--dbnsfp' and '--dbnsfp_tbi' parameters need to be specified when using this parameter.

vep_spliceai.description: Use the SpliceAI plugin with Ensembl VEP
vep_spliceai.help_text: The '--spliceai_indel', '--spliceai_indel_tbi', '--spliceai_snv' and '--spliceai_snv_tbi' parameters need to be specified when using this parameter.

vep_spliceregion.description: Use the SpliceRegion plugin with Ensembl VEP

vep_mastermind.description: Use the Mastermind plugin with Ensembl VEP
vep_mastermind.help_text: The '--mastermind' and '--mastermind_tbi' parameters need to be specified when using this parameter.

vep_maxentscan.description: Use the MaxEntScan plugin with Ensembl VEP
vep_maxentscan.help_text: The '--maxentscan' parameter need to be specified when using this parameter.

vep_eog.description: Use the custom EOG annotation with Ensembl VEP
vep_eog.help_text: The '--eog' and '--eog_tbi' parameters need to be specified when using this parameter.

vep_version.description: The version of the VEP tool to be used

vep_cache_version.description: The version of the VEP cache to be used

dbnsfp_tbi.description: Path to the index of the dbSNFP file

spliceai_indel.description: Path to the VCF containing indels for spliceAI

spliceai_indel_tbi.description: Path to the index of the VCF containing indels for spliceAI

spliceai_snv.description: Path to the VCF containing SNVs for spliceAI

spliceai_snv_tbi.description: Path to the index of the VCF containing SNVs for spliceAI

mastermind.description: Path to the VCF for Mastermind

mastermind_tbi.description: Path to the index of the VCF for Mastermind

maxentscan.description: Path to the MaxEntScan executable directory

eog.description: Path to the VCF containing EOG annotations

eog_tbi.description: Path to the index of the VCF containing EOG annotations

vcfanno_config.description: The path to the VCFanno config TOML

vcfanno_lua.description: The path to a Lua script to be used in VCFanno

vcfanno_resources.description: A comma-seperated list of resource files for VCFanno, please also supply their indices using this parameter

annotation_parameters.help_text: Annotation will only run when `--annotate true` is specified.
